user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_dauth_qop:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthQOP
get_rq_dauth_qop (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const qop_param)
{
  if (NULL == qop_param->value.str)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_NONE;
  if (qop_param->quoted)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (qop_param->value.str, \
                                               qop_param->value.len, \
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  else
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_, \
                                         qop_param->value.str, \
                                         qop_param->value.len))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_AUTH_INT;
  }
  /* No know QOP has been detected */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_QOP_INVALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function get_rq_dauth_qop:
#define MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n(q, l, u) MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_bin_n(q,l,u,MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(u))
...
#define MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_(a, s, l) ((MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(a)==(l))&&MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_(a,s,l))
...
#define MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_ "auth"
...
#define MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_ "auth-int"
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
                                               MHD_TOKEN_AUTH_INT_))
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.14 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment uses length-aware macros (MHD_str_equal_caseless_..._bin_n and MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_) to compare a static token string with a buffer and length. These macros check lengths and perform binary comparisons with explicit lengths, not a memcmp of null‑terminated strings. (Only if an underlying helper function internally used memcmp to compare C-strings without lengths would a violation occur, but nothing shown here uses memcmp on null-terminated strings.)
